item.title: Jason add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "How strange! I thought, though everybody hated and despised each other, they could not avoid loving me." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Jason add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "When the soul suffers too much, it develops a taste for misfortune." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jason add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "At the age of 40, having ordered meat very rare in restaurants all his life, he realized he actually liked it medium and not at all rare." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jason add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "He’d always been willing to confess his faults, for, by admitting them, it was as if he made them no longer exist." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Jason add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "You are damned, and we wish to share your damnation." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Jason add a quote by Tony Kushner
item.description: "<i>Purple?</i> Boy, what kind of a homosexual are you, anyway? That's not purple, Mary, that color up there is <i>mauve.</i>" -- Tony Kushner

item.title: Jason add a quote by A.E. Housman
item.description: "The tree of man was never quiet: Then 'twas the Roman, now 'tis I." -- A.E. Housman

item.title: Jason add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Jason add a quote by Helene Hanff
item.description: "I do love secondhand books that open to the page some previous owner read oftenest. The day Hazlitt came he opened to "I hate to read new books," and I hollered "Comrade!" to whoever owned it before me." -- Helene Hanff

item.title: Jason add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "You don't bless what you love...It's when you want to love and you can't manage it. You stretch out your hands and you say God forgive me that I can't love but bless this thing anyway...We have to bless what we hate...It would be better to love, but that's not always possible." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Jason add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "Nothing good is a miracle, nothing lovely is a dream." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Jason add a quote by Rick Yancey
item.description: "Self-pity is egotism undiluted, after all—self-centeredness in its purest form." -- Rick Yancey

item.title: Jason add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Céline
item.description: "I have never voted in my life... I have always known and understood that the idiots are in a majority so it's certain they will win." -- Louis-Ferdinand Céline

item.title: Jason add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "You know you've reached a new plateau of group mediocrity when even a Canadian is alarmed by your lack of individuality." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Jason add a quote by Richard Norton Smith
item.description: "There's no excuse for a dull book, a dull museum, or a dull speech. Especially when dealing with history—the most fascinating subject I know." -- Richard Norton Smith

item.title: Jason add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "I like to see an angry Englishman," said Poirot. "They are very amusing. The more emotional they feel the less command they have of language." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Jason add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "She was a good Christian woman with a large respect for religion, though she did not, of course, believe any of it was true." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Jason add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Wesley, the younger child, had had rheumatic fever when he was seven and Mrs. May thought this was what had caused him to be an intellectual." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Jason add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Mrs. May winced. She thought the word Jesus should be kept inside the church building like other words inside the bedroom." -- Flannery O'Connor
